revised_title: Inquiry into the Function of Respiration at Various Altitudes on Teneriffe
tldr: Dr. William Marcet investigates the function of respiration at various altitudes on the island and peak of Teneriffe. He discovers that a greater quantity of carbonic acid is formed in the body and exhaled at higher altitudes, suggesting that increased formation of carbonic acid may be necessary to resist the influence of cold in high-altitude regions.
